**** Etymology[edit] ****
From Proto-Indo-Aryan *sw├б, from Proto-Indo-Iranian *sw├б, from Proto-Indo-
European *sw├й (тАЬselfтАЭ). Cognate with Polish swa┬аf, Avestan ЁРмУЁРмАтАО (xс╡Ыa), Latin
suus, Ancient_Greek с╝С╧М╧В (he├│s), Persian ╪о┘И╪птАО (xod), Russian ╤Б╨▓╨╛╨╣ (svoj).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Vedic) IPA(key): /s╩Л╔Р╠Б/
    * (Classical) IPA(key): /s╠к╩Л╔Р/
**** Pronoun[edit] ****
рд╕реНрд╡ тАв (sv├б)
   1. (possessive) his/her own
   2. of self
